intro: Sabatia diffusa, commonly known as the showy yellow catchfly, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Sabatia diffusa is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
